title: Jose Mourinho sanctions the sale of Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney
text:
Wayne Rooney could be set for a contract worth £140 million in the Chinese Super League(Photo credit should read OLI SCARFF/AFP/Getty Images) Wayne Rooney’s glittering Manchester United career looks to be drawing to a rapid close after Jose Mourinho agreed to sanction his sale, according to the Sunday Mirror.
Arsenal ready to spend £85 million and ruin Manchester United's summer transfer plans The 31-year-old has slowly been falling down the pecking order at Old Trafford since Mourinho’s arrival, despite holding onto the captaincy.
Rooney broke Sir Bobby Charlton’s long-standing Manchester United goalscoring record last weekend with a late equaliser at Stoke, his 250th goal for the club, but Mourinho believes the England international is essentially surplus to requirements.
Rooney scored a record breaking 250th goal for Manchester United last weekend against Stoke (Picture: PARNABY/AFP/Getty Images) A raft of Chinese clubs are reportedly keen to offer Rooney a contract worth £140 million and make him the highest paid footballer on the planet.
More: Football Jose Mourinho delivers ultimatum to struggling Manchester United star

The European transfer window closes on Tuesday, but Chinese clubs are able to keep on buying until February 28 ahead of the start of their domestic season, which begins in March.
